TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract IWsdlExportExtension

Docs.summary: Defines endpoint or contract behaviors that can export custom metadata.

remarks.format:
## Remarks To modify and extend the Web Services Description Language (WSDL) exported by <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter> objects, implement the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension> interface on an endpoint, contract, or operation behavior (an object that implements either <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IContractBehavior>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IEndpointBehavior>, or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IOperationBehavior>) and add the behavior to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint.Behaviors%2A>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription.Behaviors%2A>, or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription.Behaviors%2A> property. In addition, you can also implement <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension> on a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement>.
> [!NOTE] > <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension> implementations are never invoked if they are implemented as an <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IServiceBehavior>.
<xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension> does not export custom policy assertions even though [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)] exports custom binding policy assertions to the appropriate element inside WSDL. If you want to export custom policy assertions, implement the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IPolicyExportExtension> interface.
The metadata publication process begins by calling <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter.ExportEndpoints%2A?displayProperty=fullName> which in turn calls <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter.ExportEndpoint%2A?displayProperty=fullName> for each endpoint.
The endpoint is exported by first exporting its contract.When exporting a contract the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter?displayProperty=fullName> calls the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension.ExportContract%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method on all <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension> implementations on the contract, and operation behaviors for that contract. Operations that use wildcard actions are not exported in metadata, so <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension> implementations on operation behaviors for these operations are not exported.
After exporting the contract, the port and binding are exported and exported policy expressions are attached.
Both the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension.ExportContract%2A> and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension.ExportEndpoint%2A> methods provide access to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter> so that <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension> implementations can report recoverable errors and warnings through the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExporter.Errors%2A> property. The context objects passed into both methods provide convenient mappings from exported WSDL elements to properties of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> objects.
If an <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension> implementation throws an exception on export, the generated metadata is in an inconsistent state and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter> object should be discarded.
> [!NOTE] > Custom export extension must run after the built-in serializer populates the service description.
## Examples The following code example shows an <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension> that adds custom documentation attributes to the WSDL file as WSDL annotations.
[!code-csharp[C_CustomWSDLExtensions#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_customwsdlextensions/cs/wsdldocumentationattribute.cs#6)] [!code-csharp[C_CustomWSDLExtensions#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_customwsdlextensions/cs/wsdldocumentationattribute.cs#7)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ExportContract(class System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter exporter, class System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlContractConversionContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: The that exports the contract information.
Provides mappings from exported WSDL elements to the contract description.
Docs.summary: Writes custom Web Services Description Language (WSDL) elements into the generated WSDL for a contract.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension.ExportContract%2A> method is called when the metadata export system is exporting the contract. Only contract and operation behaviors implementing <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension> get the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension.ExportContract%2A> call. All behaviors implementing <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension> get the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension.ExportEndpoint%2A> call.
Use the `context` parameter to modify the WSDL to be exported. For an example, see the Example section.
## Examples The following code example shows an <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension> that adds custom documentation attributes to the WSDL file as WSDL annotations.
[!code-csharp[C_CustomWSDLExtensions#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_customwsdlextensions/cs/wsdldocumentationattribute.cs#6)] [!code-csharp[C_CustomWSDLExtensions#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_customwsdlextensions/cs/wsdldocumentationattribute.cs#7)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void ExportEndpoint(class System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter exporter, class System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlEndpointConversionContext context) cil managed

Docs.param: The that exports the endpoint information.
Provides mappings from exported WSDL elements to the endpoint description.
Docs.summary: Writes custom Web Services Description Language (WSDL) elements into the generated WSDL for an endpoint.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Implement the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension.ExportEndpoint%2A> method to modify the WSDL exported for an endpoint. This method is called after the contract has been exported by <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension.ExportContract%2A>.
## Examples The following code example shows an <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension> that adds custom documentation attributes to the WSDL file as WSDL annotations.
[!code-csharp[C_CustomWSDLExtensions#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_customwsdlextensions/cs/wsdldocumentationattribute.cs#6)] [!code-csharp[C_CustomWSDLExtensions#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/c_customwsdlextensions/cs/wsdldocumentationattribute.cs#7)]
